awd_abstract_narration: The Jackson Laboratory will initiate a ten-week,                                residential, Young Scholars project in mammalian genetics                       for 10 students entering the 12th grade.                                                                                                                        This summer year program will emphasize the study of                            experimental genetics using the mouse.  The creation of                         inbred, genetically defined strains of mice, development of                     methods for culture of mammalian cells, and techniques for                      manipulating genetic material have made the mouse the                           preferred mammalian model for this research.  Students                          design and carry out an original piece of research,                             interpret their data, write and present oral reports on                         their findings, and learn complex laboratory procedures.
org_div_long_name: Division of Research on Learning in Formal and Informal Settings (DRL)
